Articles.Content: So I'm hovering over the launchpad at 100m. Exactlly over the launchpad and just hovering. I EVA'd and I'm outside the capsule, holding on to the ladder. Why can't I get the biome? It just says flying over the shores.
The launchpad only counts as a biome if you're landed on it. Same for the KSC (I think) and the runway.
Damn, all the science checklists had those listed as being able to fly over. I guess I haven't checked for a few versions though.
But you were able to EVA while hovering in place, so that's pretty awesome. I don't think I would be able to do that without Kerbal death happening.
You used to be able to get the flying eva report just by getting out and sitting on the ladder whilst the rocket was stationary on the pad. Not sure if they've changed this or not.
You can still do that, but it still just reads as over the Shores.

Does the launchpad have a "Flying" situation? I thought it only had the "Landed", "Space over" and "High over" situations...

Of course, the space ones may have been removed since I heard of them.
